definition:
1. Poured out freely; profuse. [Obs.] So should our joy be very effuse. Barrow. 2. Disposed to pour out freely; prodigal. [Obs.] Young. 3. (Bot.)  Spreading loosely, especially on one side; as, an effuse inflorescence. Loudon. 4. (Zo√∂l.)  Having the lips, or edges, of the aperture abruptly spreading; -- said of certain shells.

Effusion; loss. "Much effuse of blood." Shak.

To pour out like a stream or freely; to cause to exude; to shed. [R.] With gushing blood effused. Milton.

To emanate; to issue. Thomson.
